Evansville.Bi-State Vietnam Gold Star Bridges: The Bi-State Vietnam Gold Star Twin Bridges, usually referred to as simply The Twin Bridges, connect Henderson, Kentucky and Evansville, Indiana along U.S. Route 41 (US 41), one mile (1.6 km) south of the (temporary) southern terminus of Interstate 69 (I-69). The bridges carry nearly 40,000 vehicles a day across the Ohio River. The northbound bridge opened to traffic on July 4, 1932, and the southbound bridge opened on December 16, 1965.
